item.title: Unix philosophy-esque approach to web tooling
item.description: [Ongoing. I’ll be adding for snippets to this page that I find useful over time Suggestions are also welcome] Creating WebP images If you want to recursively create .webp versions of images in a folder (same name, saved in same location, different extension name), this script will do that while IFS= read -r -d '' file; do cwebp -q 90 "$file" -o "${file%.*}.webp" || true done < <(find ./ -type f \( -name "*.
